economic_context.details: Multiple disputes related to Thomasse's occupation as paistre of horse herd (damages to fields, negligence in watching herd). Significant debt disputes with Antoine Paris (money borrowing and difficult repayment). Property dispute with Demenge Masson over terasse of shared house. Economic dispute with Nicolas Claudon Petit Homme (gagé for non-payment after selling wheat). Obligation dispute with Bastien Lalemant.

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a very well-documented trial with 18 witnesses and detailed testimony. Thomasse was accused primarily in her role as paistre (herder) of horses, and many disputes centered on her occupational responsibilities. She maintained firm denials even under torture. The trial ended with renvoy jusqu'a rappel (released subject to recall) rather than death or explicit banishment, though PG des Vosges had requested 10-year banishment. She was denounced again in 1620 and had apparently fled. Notable features: strong defense with counter-accusations of theft and fraud against witnesses; unusual healing episode with chambriere; economic context of military troubles; brother-in-law as witness against her.
